{{news release|1=article|date=September 2017}}
[[File:Zvi Gabbay.jpg|thumb|Zvi Gabbay]]
'''Dr. Zvi Gabbay''' is a partner and the Head of the Capital Markets and Financial Regulation Department at the [[Barnea & Co.|Barnea & Co]]. law firm. Prior to this, Dr. Gabbay served as the Head of Enforcement and a member of management at the [[Israel Securities Authority]] (ISA).
== Education == Upon completing his military service as an officer and combatant in the [[Nahal Brigade|Nahal Infantry Brigade]] of the [[Israel Defense Forces]], Gabbay studied law at the [[Hebrew University of Jerusalem]], earning his LL.B. He went on to receive his [[Master of Laws]] degree (LL.M) [[Magna cum Laude|magna cum laude]] from [[Bar-Ilan University]]. Gabbay continued his studies in [[New York City|New York]] at [[Columbia University]], where he earned a second Master of Laws degree summa cum laude in 2004.<ref name=":0" />
During his studies, Gabbay worked as a teaching assistant, as well as took part in the mediation clinic at Columbia University. After receiving his second LL.M., Gabbay continued his academic studies at Columbia University, earning a [[Doctor of Juridical Science]] (J.S.D.) in 2006.<ref name=":0" /> His research focused on alternatives to the criminal justice system, based on analyses of administrative law, disciplinary hearings, and restorative justice.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Restorative Works|last=|first=|publisher=International Institute for Restorative Practices|year=2013|isbn=|location=Canada|pages=13, 55}}</ref>
== Public Activities == Gabbay served as a member of the committee assembled by former Minister of Justice [[Yaakov Neeman]], and headed by then [[Deputy Attorney General|Deputy Attorney-General]] (criminal matters) Raz Nazari, which re-examined the issue of corporate criminal liability. The committee published a memorandum for the draft bill Criminal Liability for Corporations Law (2014).
Gabbay is currently a member of the board of governors of the [[International Institute for Restorative Practices]] (IIRP) Europe<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://www.iirp.edu/who-we-are/trustees/60-zvi-gabbay-esq-j-s-d|title=Zvi Gabbay, Esq., J.S.D.|last=Staff|first=IIRP|website=www.iirp.edu|language=en-GB|access-date=2017-09-06}}</ref>.
Gabbay is also a member of the board of governors of Amutat Kedem, an Israeli [[Nonprofit organization|NPO]] that engages in conciliatory processes using family group conferences and restorative justice to help children at-risk youth, and youth offenders.
During his residence in the [[United States]], Gabbay engaged in [[volunteer work]], mediating more than 50 cases in the various courts in New York. He also served as a moderator and mediator in the Community Impact Panel program, which convened at the [[Midtown Community Court]] in [[Manhattan]]. Gabbay volunteers as a mediator in business disputes in Israeli courts.
== Career == Gabbay began his legal career as a [[prosecutor]] in the [[Tel Aviv]] District Attorney’s Office (Criminal Department). There he managed all stages of criminal cases, from investigations, trials, and rulings through to appeals. Upon completing his studies in New York, Gabbay joined the international law firm [[Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom]] LLP. During his tenure at the firm, Gabbay focused on representing private and business clients undergoing internal investigations, working in collaboration with the firm’s civil litigation department. He also engaged in pro bono representation of clients in civil and criminal courts.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.legal500.com/firms/13399-barnea-co/offices/14050-tel-aviv-israel/lawyers/9017194|title=The Legal 500 > Barnea & Co > Tel Aviv, ISRAEL > Lawyer profiles > Adv Dr Zvi Gabbay|website=www.legal500.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-09-06}}</ref>
Gabbay returned to Israel in 2008 and was appointed the Head of Enforcement and a member of management at the Israel Securities Authority (ISA). As Head of Enforcement, Gabbay handled the interfaces between the regulatory arm of the ISA and the enforcement powers it wields<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-teva-minor-player-in-alleged-us-price-fixing-1001168668|title=Teva minor player in alleged US price fixing - Globes English|last=|first=|date=|website=Globes|language=he|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-09-06|quote=Dr. Zvi Gabbay, formerly responsible for enforcement in the Israel Securities Authority}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.kahollavan.co.il/ACCI/AccJan10/moreInfo.html|title=ACCI|website=www.kahollavan.co.il|access-date=2017-09-06}}</ref>. In this context, he engaged in legislative initiatives and in forging new regulations. Gabbay was also part of the lean team that drove the enactment of the Administrative Enforcement Law.
In 2011, Gabbay left the ISA and became a partner at the Gornitzky and Co. law firm<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gornitzky.com/inappropriately-expand-israel-securities-authoritys-authority|title=Inappropriately expand Israel Securities Authority's authority|website=www.gornitzky.com|access-date=2017-09-06}}</ref>. Two years later, in 2013, he resigned and founded a boutique capital markets law firm: Adini, Berger, Gabbay.
In 2016, Gabbay joined Barnea & Co. as a partner and department head. Gabbay provides assistance and legal counsel to public companies and investment houses in Israel on issues involving the capital market and corporate governance. Gabbay also represents clients before various enforcement bodies in relation to investigations and administrative inquiries<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.barlaw.co.il/attorneys/3827/|title=Zvi Gabbay, Capital Markets {{!}} Barnea & Co.|work=Barnea & Co.|access-date=2017-09-06|language=en-US}}</ref>.
=== Academic lectures ===
Gabbay was a guest lecturer at the [[College of Law and Business]], where he taught a [[seminar]] on white collar crime. He has also lectured at both the School of Law at the College of Management and the School of Law at Columbia University on mediation and negotiations.
=== Books ===
* ''Administrative Enforcement of Israeli Securities Laws'', Bursi Publishing House<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.gornitzky.com/a-new-book-published-by-dr-zvi-gabbay|title=A new book published by Dr. Zvi Gabbay|website=www.gornitzky.com|access-date=2017-09-06}}</ref>

Deal", Calcalist (in Hebrew) website, April 19, 2017] *[https://www.themarker.com/opinion/1.2997923 Zvi Gabbay and Sapir Malul, “Hedge Funds Don’t Need Regulating,” The Marker (in Hebrew) website, July 5, 2016 ] *[http://103fm.maariv.co.il/programs/media.aspx?ZrqvnVq=GMLDKE&c41t4nzVQ=ELD “Where is the Money,” 103fm (in hebrew), June 20, 2017 ] *[http://www.mako.co.il/news-channel2/Economy-Newcast-q2_2017/Article-1bb463c5256cc51004.htm?sCh=9d706603e7478110&pId=25483675 Channel 2 News, Mako (in hebrew), June 20, 2017]
